Kaka: Milan on right track
Kaka believes Milan are finally ‘on the right track’ with Paolo Maldini set for the role of technical director.

Maldini is expected to be joined on Milan’s new-look board by Zvonimir Boban and possibly more of his former Milan teammates.

With that in mind, could Kaka be one of them?

“Boban and I talked about a lot of things, but he didn’t tell me anything about his future,” the Brazilian told Sky Sport Italia.

“I’m so sorry that they missed out on the Champions League by just one point.

“We’ll see which direction they take, but there are shoots of a recovery and there’s Paolo Maldini. I think they’re on the right track.

“Gattuso brought the DNA of Milan to these lads. Leo made his choices, he’ll have had his reasons.

“Maldini is a great example for me. He waited nine years to return to Milan. I’ll take the same path as him.

“It’s hard to break away from Milan. Even in Brazil I always read their news and watch their games.”

Marco Giampaolo is already in Milan and ready to sign the two-year contract, with option for a third, once Sampdoria release him.

Sky Sport Italia report Giampaolo has already returned to Italy after his brief vacation in Croatia.

He is expected to meet with Sampdoria President Massimo Ferrero tomorrow and can then sign the contract with Milan.

It’ll be a two-year deal with option for a third, worth approximately €2m per season.

As for Samp, they have set their sights on Stefano Pioli or Eusebio Di Francesco as their new tactician.
.@AlfredoPedulla exclusive: Milan really like Roma left-back Luca Pellegrini and have made an inquiry about him. Juventus also like the player.

Milan need to raise funds before June 30 and it’s reported they could sell Suso to Atletico Madrid for €40m.

The Rossoneri are in the middle of an appeal against Financial Fair Play violations, but are trying to show UEFA they’re finally on the right track.

In order to get the books at least slightly balanced for this season, they have to sell at a profit by June 30.

According to SportMediaset and the Corriere dello Sport, the most likely exit is for Spanish winger Suso towards Atletico Madrid.

He was purchased from Liverpool for a measly €1.3m in January 2015 and could be sold for his €40m release clause.

It has been a fairly disappointing season for the 25-year-old, scoring eight goals with nine assists in 41 competitive games.

The Rossoneri are in the middle of an appeal against Financial Fair Play violations, but are trying to show UEFA they’re finally on the right track.

In order to get the books at least slightly balanced for this season, they have to sell at a profit by June 30.

According to SportMediaset and the Corriere dello Sport, the most likely exit is for Spanish winger Suso towards Atletico Madrid.

He was purchased from Liverpool for a measly €1.3m in January 2015 and could be sold for his €40m release clause.

It has been a fairly disappointing season for the 25-year-old, scoring eight goals with nine assists in 41 competitive games.

Goodbye and Thank you Suso

replies.msg:
Milan have been scouting RB Salzburg striker Sekou Koita, who scored against Italy for Mali in the Under-20 World Cup.
According to Calciomercato.com, Rossoneri representatives were in the stands when Italy squeezed past 10-man Mali in a 4-2 quarter-final thriller.
Koita was on target, his fifth goal of the competition, and seems to have done enough to earn a summer approach from the San Siro side.
His Mali also won the Under-20 African Cup in February and reached the Final of the Under-17 World Cup in 2015.
The striker spent this season on loan with FC Liefering, finding the net six times with seven assists in 23 competitive games at club level.

replies.msg: Maldini and Boban have a dream, or rather a goal: a Milan that can return to dominate in the shortest possible time. It is this mission - writes La Gazzetta dello Sport - that "Zorro" and the former captain discussed after the farewell of Leonardo, to tighten the pact of rebirth. And it is to the construction of this project that they are working in the last few days, even if the Croatian has not yet retired from Fifa.

STRATEGY - Only after choosing the sports director - the first interview for that assignment will be done with Frederic Massara - it will be possible to proceed officially with the players to take negotiations. According to reports from the rosea, it is not so certain that all purchases should correspond to the identikit of the "perfect under 25", talented and affordable at an economic level. For key roles, in fact, as in midfield, Milan could invest more. Boban will play a leading role in the choice of midfielders, as defenders will have to pass the Maldini exam.

CENTROCAMPO - The idea is that quality players and leaders are needed in the middle of the field. A thick director, therefore, but also a mezzala who knows how to touch the ball well next to him: in a nutshell, many good feet are needed where the maneuver develops. All reinforcements, however, must be functional to the tactical project of Marco Giampaolo.

replies.msg: Sampdoria- In 2016 he passes to the Sampdoria team, making his debut with more than positive results. He finished in tenth place, with the important double success in the derbies: it hadn't happened since the 1959-60 season that both city challenges were resolved in favor of the Dorians. The victories against the Milanese also shine, in which Sampdoria gets 9 points out of 12 available. In the 2017-2018 season he confirmed his team in tenth place, winning yet another derby against Genoa and the important challenges against Milan, Juventus and Rome. In this last season at Sampdoria, Giampaolo takes his team to ninth place, winning decisive matches, yet another derby and matches against Juventus, Milan and Napoli. Thanks to his offensive game, Fabio Quagliarella makes as many as 26 goals.

Giampaolo has now left Milano after meeting with Maldini to arrange the final details in view of the now-defined agreement to become the new Milan coach. At this point, only the official announcement is missing. [Sky]

Mino Raiola (Manolas' agent) was contacted directly by Maldini and Massara. Raiola has given Milan the green light even without Champions League. Milan asked Roma for a discount on the €36m release clause, but Roma said 'No'. Juve are also interested in him. [@FabrizioRomano]

Giampaolo had a meeting with Boban & Maldini yesterday, where he clarified his idea for the squad and was provided context on how the mercato will be conducted.

There is an agreement between the parties. Giampaolo will sign a 2 year contract at €2m/yr (with option for a 3rd). The official announcement is expected for early next week. [La Gazzetta dello Sport]
